intro: Neurotecoma, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its branched stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are alternate and have a rough texture, while its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. Neurotecoma is known for its ability to tolerate drought conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
